job_title: Social Worker/Case Manager in Meridian, MS

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Meridian, MS
pros:
Family atmosphere between coworkers. 
Good Nurse to Physician relationships.
Friendly in house pharmacy
cons:
Very low pay. $23 with no opportunity for raises besides clinical ladder. 
1:3 ratio in ICU is common with 1:4 occasionally. 
Very micromanaged by Administration. 
Complaints or suggestions by staff are not respected and often scrutinized. 
Gaslighting is a daily occurrence.
No 24hr in house pharmacy (you mix your own drugs at night).
Mandated overtime for FT employees. (36/48hr pay period)

pros: Some of the employees were friendly
cons: Wasn’t a good work environment, management was bad!

pros: People are nice, kept clean
cons: Don’t give raises or try to help

review_title: It was a good place to work

pros: I love the patients . Overtime is good & pay -raise can be better .

pros: Very supportive leadership, good pay

review_title: The Hospital has been a blessing.  Their educational assistance program is awesome!
pros: Total Autonomy within your profession, great bosses, and flexibility of settings in which to practice.  Rush provides a great structured environment with an awesome Rehabilitation Department.
cons: You may have to work at multiple sites.  There are hardly any raises or bonuses.  No real ladder for promotion.  Meridian, MS has a high crime rate at this point.

pros: The hiring process was easy, they provided a great orientation to the facility, the therapy staff was amazing to work with; everyone helped each other and made the work day go by smooth.  This was by far the best experience I have had at a job thus far! I would highly recommend Rush Foundation Hospital to anyone in the Meridian area!
cons: I thought Rush Foundation Hospital was a great facility and had no complaints.  The senior management staff treated you as an equal, and the co-workers in both rehab and nursing were wonderful to work with.

review_title: This hospital has been a blessing.
pros: Student Loan Repayment is the best thing that happened with my post graduate studies.  They have been committed to make my work life as comfortable as possible
cons: Driving Distance/ commute to work is a bit much due to the poor housing market in the rural communities.  Gas prices and wear on your vehicle will play a part in working for this company if you do not live in the city. Meridian also have a high crime rate

review_title: My experience from dealing with the staff through my pre-employment process has been great.
pros:
If you love what you do and want coworkers that have a family bond. 
YOU CAN GET AS MUCH OVER TIME AS YOU WANT.
cons:
Underpaying employees 
Low hourly wage pay 
Do not pay you as much as you would expect 
McDonalds crew members get paid more an hour for some positions withheld in the hospital

review_title: lab and rural health clinic previous employee
pros: cant really say much here except that I loved my co-workers like family and I wanted to stay on here but the HR dept and my supervisor couldnt make needed time off work out
cons: they do not allow time off for required surgeries, and health insurance was Rush doctors or none, and all my doctors prior to working there were outside rush

pros: My co-workers were very nice. The pay was decent. One day there was ice ou on the roads and my supervisor understood I would be late.
cons: Computer system was very outdated. They used an extremely old version of Windows. It was unnecessarily complicated, doing my job difficult. Equipment needed to be upgraded.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Nas Meridian, MS
pros: Gained experience in trauma medicine. Fast paced unit. Working with experienced and trained nurses in critical situations. Learned to deal with family members in time of crises
cons: Long hours - 12 hour nights.  Worked understaffed in some situations. Deficit of needed equipment and supplies at times.  Deficit of techs in the department.

pros: Good coworkers made this job bearable.
cons: It was terrible. I had never hated a job as much I did nursing at this facility. Short staffed, no help, and I was getting new nurse pay when I had 4 years under my belt. They used my old wage from previous employment with them when I was fresh out of school. That in itself makes me think way less of this company. Not to mention administration sucks!! They need to clean house!!

review_title: GREAT PLACE TO START YOUR CAREER!

pros: It's a very warm environment. Everyone is friendly, and everyone speaks to each other. It is a smaller hospital with a family feel.
cons: There isn't much upward mobility. There are few pay increases, no bonuses, and the base pay is way below their competitors.
